html:
** Payment firm Visa Inc's shares V.N up 1.34% at $231.89 premarket

** Co and AMZN reached an agreement to accept its credit cards across its network, ending a standoff between the two that threatened to disrupt e-commerce payments and deal a blow to the U.S.-based payments processor (Full Story)

** AMZN had said in November it was considering dropping Visa as partner on its U.S. co-branded credit card, after earlier confirming it would stop accepting Visa credit cards in the UK because of high transaction fees

** Details of the deal were not disclosed but Visa and other payments cards have faced increased pressure about their fees as more shoppers have turned online during the pandemic

** Up to Wednesday's close, stock had risen 5.59% YTD


(Reporting by Manya Saini in Bengaluru)

(( Manya.Saini@thomsonreuters.com ;))
